data.title: 'Porsche Unseen Design Studies' debuts this holiday season at Curvistan
data.description: Since opening in August 2024, Curvistan Bangkok has redefined leisure and entertainment for the Porsche community and beyond as a bar, a café, an art gallery and a hangout that celebrates car culture, art and design.

data.title: Korean Cultural Center in Thailand hosts Korean War Memorial Concert 2024
data.description: Korean Cultural Center in Thailand hosts the Korean War Memorial Concert 2024 by R.O.K Navy Symphonic band on November 26 at 7pm at KBANK Siam PIC Ganesha Theatre.

data.title: MAPIM, IMAR to work with NGOs to develop Malaysia-Thailand border economy
data.description: The Malaysian Consultative Council of Islamic Organisation (MAPIM) and the Secretariat on Regional MADANI Initiatives (IMAR) are uniting NGOs from Malaysia and Thailand to boost economic development and promote peace in the border regions of both nations.

data.title: Buriram get the better of Sukhothai
data.description: Defending champions Buriram United moved to within three points of Thai League 1 leaders Bangkok United following a 2-0 victory over Sukhothai at home on Friday night.

data.title: Gao ends Supanida's run in China
data.description: Supanida Katethong bowed out in the women

data.title: Nine people named in Khao Kradong land dispute petition
data.description: A petition has been submitted to the Central Criminal Court for Corruption and Misconduct Cases against nine people involved in Khao Kradong

data.title: Paving the way for ex-PM's return
data.description: Political observers appear to be on the same page that the path has been laid for  fugitive  former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra  to  return  home.

data.title: Forest rangers get submachine guns
data.description: The Royal Forest Department has bought locally-made weapons from the Ministry of Defence, saying it was the first time the department has obtained modern submachine guns for the protection of over 32 million rai of the country

data.title: Alarm over end of free meds policy
data.description: A civil society group is unhappy with the Medical Council of Thailand

data.title: Campaign takes aim against discrimination
data.description: Thai civil society organisations have begun a campaign promoting five recommendations to the government they say would help tackle the discrimination that is still prevalent against vulnerable groups.

data.title: Mae Sot's sour trafficking record
data.description: Mae Sot, a town on the Thai-Myanmar border in Tak province, is notorious as a hub for cross-border human trafficking and transnational organised crime run by Chinese mafia syndicates. Despite this, government action has been grossly inadequate to combat the problem.

data.title: EC's probe  into Thaksin  carries on
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) will continue to probe former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra

data.title: Grim reaper at the wheel; ex-wife's revenge; hand in a basket
data.description: Old geezer out for a spin

data.title: Leicester woes continue with loss to Chelsea
data.description: LEICESTER, England - Goals from Nicolas Jackson and Enzo Fernandez helped Chelsea to a 2-1 Premier League win at Leicester City on Saturday that would have been more comfortable if Blues winger Noni Madueke had not blocked teammate Cole Palmer’s goalbound shot.

data.title: VP’s assassination comment rattles Philippines
data.description: MANILA - Philippine security agencies stepped up safety protocols on Saturday after Vice President Sara Duterte said she would have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr assassinated if she herself were killed.

data.title: Frenchman missing after boat capsizes
data.description: An elderly French tourist went missing on Saturday after his tour boat capsized in strong winds in the reservoir at the Rajjaprabha Dam in Ban Ta Khun district of Surat Thani, local authorities said.

data.title: Hospital tycoon wanted for fraud ‘has fled country’
data.description: The wife and daughter of  Boon Vanasin , the founder of Thonburi Healthcare Group (THG), who remains at large in China, have reportedly surrendered to police in response to warrants issued on charges of public  fraud .

data.title: Officials ready for provincial elections
data.description: The Provincial Administrative Organisation ( PAO ) chairman  elections  in Udon Thani, Phetchaburi and Nakhon Si Thammarat are expected to proceed without any incidents, says the  Election Commission  (EC).

data.title: Sectarian violence claims 18 more lives in Pakistan
data.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan - At least 18 people were killed and 30 injured in further sectarian violence in northwestern Pakistan, officials said on Saturday, as tensions remained high following attacks on transport convoys that killed dozens of civilians this week.

data.title: Lengthy elephant tusks a health concern
data.description: An animal welfare group has expressed concern about the possible trimming of  Plai Sak Surin ’s tusks and whether the  elephant  might be returned to  Sri Lanka  to resume his role as a goodwill ambassador.

data.title: ONE Friday Fights 88: Zahidi’s head-kick KO highlights early slew of finishes and bonuses
data.description: Abdelali Zahidi’s stunning head-kick KO was the highlight of an action-packed international portion of last night’s ONE Friday Fights 88 card in Bangkok, amid a slew of early finishes and bonuses.

data.title: New Koh Kut tourism campaign launched
data.description: TRAT -  Koh Kut  has many interesting beaches to offer that are often overlooked, according to the local Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) office, which has launched a new campaign to promote the island’s attractions during the peak season from now until April.

data.title: Justice sought for teens killed in collision
data.description: More than 50 residents of Umphang village in  Tak  province gathered at a local police station on Saturday to demand justice after two teenagers were killed in a  traffic accident  that they blamed on a deputy district chief.

data.title: 29 illegal migrants found crammed inside pickup box
data.description: PATTANI - Twenty-nine  illegal migrants  from  Myanmar  were found crammed inside an enclosed box in the bed of a pickup truck at a road checkpoint in Sai Buri district of this southern province on Saturday.

data.title: Analysis cites potential impact of Trump presidency on Thai economy
data.description: Economic and Business Forecasting Centre outlines both direct and indirect repercussions for Thailand

data.title: Financial phishing plagues SEA firms; Thailand hit hardest with 140K+ attacks
data.description: From January to June 2024, Kaspersky anti-phishing technologies detected 336,294 phishing attacks launched at organisations and businesses in Southeast Asia.

data.title: Israel-Thailand partnership aims to shape the future of food
data.description: FoodTech Roadshow in Bangkok showcases latest advancements in food technology

data.title: Buddhist monastery ‘using human bodies for meditation’
data.description: Forty-one  cadavers  used in meditation practices at a Buddhist  monastery  in Phichit province are being identified in a police investigation to determine whether they were obtained and used legally.

data.title: Thailand and Malaysia to deepen tourism ties
data.description: Thai Ministry of Foreign Affairs dispatches advisers to Malaysia to discuss how to enhance tourism cooperation

data.title: Singaporean man nabbed for allegedly faking bomb threat at Don Mueang
data.description: Flight FD 3114, with 162 passengers and six crew members, was preparing to take off to Hat Yai
